'The Nature Conservancy' is a US charitable environmental organization that
works to preserve the lands and waters on which all life depends. [http://www.nature.org/aboutus/ About The Nature
Conservancy]

The Indiana Dunes of Northwest Indiana played a role in the formation of the
Nature Conservancy. Smith, S. & Mark, S. (2009).
[http://www.southshorejournal.org/index.php/issues/volume-3-2009/83-
journals/vol-3-2009/75-the-historical-roots-of-the-nature-conservancy-in-the-
northwest-indianachicagoland-region-from-science-to-preservation "The Historical
Roots of the Nature Conservancy in the Northwest Indiana/Chicagoland Region:
From Science to Preservation"]. The South Shore Journal, 3. Volo Bog in
northern Illinois was the first purchase of the Illinois Nature Conservancy
thanks to the fundraising efforts of Cyrus Mark, the first president of the
Illinois Nature Conservancy.

Founded in 1951, The Nature Conservancy works in more than 30 countries,
including all 50 states of the United States. The Conservancy has over one
million members, and has protected more than 119 million acres of land and 5,000
miles of rivers worldwide. The Nature Conservancy also operates more than 100
marine conservation projects globally. The organization's assets
total $5.64 billion as of 2009.

The Nature Conservancy is the Americas' largest environmental nonprofit by
assets and by revenue. [http://www.forbes.com/lists/2011/14/200-largest-us-charities-
11_rank-environment-animal.html The 200 Largest U.S. Charities List:
Environment/Animal - Forbes.com]

The Nature Conservancy rates as one of the most trusted national organizations
in Harris Interactive polls every year since
2005. [http://www.harrisinteractive.com/harris_poll/index.asp?PID=983 2008
Harris
Poll] [http://www.harrisinteractive.com/harris_poll/index.asp?PID=843
2007 Harris
poll] [http://www.harrisinteractive.com/harris_poll/index.asp?PID=715
2006 Harris
poll] [http://www.harrisinteractive.com/harris_poll/index.asp?PID=619
2005 Harris poll] Forbes magazine rated The Nature Conservancy's
fundraising efficiency at 88% in its 2005 survey of the largest U.S. charities. [http://www.forbes.com/lists/2006/14/pf_phil_06charities_Nature-
Conservancy_CH0127.html Nature Conservancy - Forbes.com] The Conservancy
received a four-star rating from Charity Navigator in 2008 (three-star in 2010)-
[http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.summary&orgid=4208
Charity Navigator Rating - The Nature Conservancy] and was named by that
organization in 2005 on their list of "10 of the Best Charities Everyone's Heard
Of". The American Institute of Philanthropy gives the Conservancy an Aâ rating
and includes it on its list of "Top-Rated Charities".

The Nature Conservancy is led by President and CEO Mark Tercek, a former
managing director at Goldman Sachs, and an adjunct professor at New York
University's Stern School of Business. [http://www.nature.org/pressroom/leadership/art24763.html Mark Tercek
Bio - Nature Conservancy] The organization draws from all segments of the
community. Retired General Norman Schwarzkopf, the commander of coalition forces
during the First Gulf War, was a member of the Conservancy's President's
Conservation Council.
